item.author: Reuters

item.title: 俄罗斯称上个月附近波罗的海天然气管道附近的电信电缆受损
item.description:
A Russian fibre optic cable under the Baltic Sea was damaged last month only 28 km (17 miles) from where a gas pipeline linking Finland and Estonia was damaged soon afterwards, Russian state company Rostelecom said on Tuesday.翻译:俄罗斯国营公司 Rostelecom 周二表示，上个月，波罗的海下的一条俄罗斯光缆受损，距离连接芬兰和爱沙尼亚的天然气管道不久后受损的地方仅 28 公里（17 英里）。

Finnish police believe damage to the Balticconnector gas pipeline was caused by a Chinese container ship dragging its anchor along the seabed but have not concluded whether this was an accident or a deliberate act.翻译:芬兰警方认为，波罗的海连接器天然气管道的损坏是由一艘中国集装箱船在海底拖锚造成的，但尚未得出这是意外还是故意行为的结论。

Security of sub-sea cables and pipelines in the Baltic has become a top concern against the background of the Ukraine war, especially since the blowing-up of Russia's Nord Stream gas pipelines last year. Investigators have yet to establish who was responsible.翻译:在乌克兰战争的背景下，特别是去年俄罗斯北溪天然气管道爆炸以来，波罗的海海底电缆和管道的安全已成为人们最关心的问题。调查人员尚未确定谁应对此负责。

In a statement, Rostelecom did not comment on what had caused the "accident" to the fibre cable that links Russia's Baltic exclave of Kaliningrad to the rest of the country.翻译:Rostelecom 在一份声明中没有对连接俄罗斯波罗的海飞地加里宁格勒和该国其他地区的光缆“事故”的原因发表评论。

However, it noted the proximity of the incident to the damaged Balticconnector gas pipeline, in terms of both geography and timing.翻译:然而，它指出，无论是在地理上还是在时间上，该事件与受损的波罗的海连接器天然气管道都很接近。

"Damage to the Rostelecom company's fiber optic cable in the Baltic Sea was recorded on October 7, 2023 at 23:30 (Moscow time). The location of the cable damage is located 28 km from the section of the Baltic Connector gas pipeline damaged on October 8," it said.翻译:“Rostelecom公司在波罗的海的光缆损坏记录于2023年10月7日23时30分（莫斯科时间）。光缆损坏位置距离波罗的海连接器天然气管道受损部分28公里。 10 月 8 日，”它说。

Finnish police leading the pipeline investigation have named the Hong-Kong-flagged container carrier NewNew Polar Bear as the prime suspect in damaging the gas pipeline. A large anchor was found nearby, and the investigators believe the pipe was broken as a ship dragged it across the sea bed.翻译:领导管道调查的芬兰警方已将悬挂香港国旗的集装箱运输公司 NewNew Polar Bear 列为破坏天然气管道的主要嫌疑人。附近发现了一个大锚，调查人员认为，当一艘船将其拖过海床时，管道破裂了。

Operator Gasgrid has said the pipeline could be out of commission until April or longer. China has said it is willing to provide the necessary information in accordance with international law.翻译:运营商 Gasgrid 表示，该管道可能要等到四月或更长时间才会停止运行。中方表示愿意根据国际法提供必要信息。

Two other Baltic telecoms cables, connecting Estonia to Finland and Sweden, were also damaged on Oct. 7 and 8.翻译:另外两条连接爱沙尼亚与芬兰和瑞典的波罗的海电信电缆也在 10 月 7 日和 8 日遭到损坏。

In its statement, Rostelecom said a specialised vessel had started repairs on the fibre optic cable on Nov. 5 and the work was expected to take 10 days, depending on weather conditions.翻译:Rostelecom 在声明中表示，一艘专门船只已于 11 月 5 日开始修复光纤电缆，预计工作需要 10 天，具体时间取决于天气情况。

It said users had not been affected because data was transmitted via terrestrial routes and backup satellite channels.翻译:该公司表示，用户没有受到影响，因为数据是通过地面路线和备份卫星通道传输的。

Additional reporting by Anne Kauranen and Terje Solsvik Editing by Gareth Jones翻译:Anne Kauranen 和 Terje Solsvik 的补充报道 Gareth Jones 编辑
item.author: Mark Trevelyan

item.title: IMF上调中国2023年、2024年GDP增​​长预测
item.description:
China's economy is set to grow 5.4% this year, having made a "strong" post-COVID recovery, the International Monetary Fund said on Tuesday, making an upward revision to its earlier forecast of 5% growth, while expecting slower growth next year.翻译:国际货币基金组织(IMF)周二表示，中国经济在疫情后实现了“强劲”复苏，今年预计将增长5.4%，上调了此前5%的增长预测，同时预计明年增长将放缓。

The IMF said continued weakness in the property sector and subdued external demand could restrict gross domestic product growth to 4.6% in 2024, which was still better than the 4.2% forecast contained in its World Economic Outlook (WEO), published in October.翻译:国际货币基金组织表示，房地产行业持续疲软和外部需求低迷可能会限制2024年国内生产总值增长至4.6%，这仍然好于10月发布的《世界经济展望》(WEO)中4.2%的预测。

The upward revision followed a decision by China to approve a 1 trillion yuan ($137 billion) sovereign bond issue and allow local governments to frontload part of their 2024 bond quotas, in a move to support the economy.翻译:上调之前，中国决定批准发行 1 万亿元人民币（1,370 亿美元）的主权债券，并允许地方政府预付部分 2024 年债券配额，以支持经济。

"We have revised up growth by 0.4 percentage points in both years relative to our October WEO projections, reflecting stronger than expected growth in the third quarter and the new policy support that was recently announced," IMF's First Deputy Managing Director Gita Gopinath said in Beijing.翻译:国际货币基金组织第一副总裁吉塔·戈皮纳特在北京表示：“相对于 10 月份《世界经济展望》的预测，我们将这两年的增长率上调了 0.4 个百分点，反映出第三季度的增长强于预期以及最近宣布的新政策支持。” 。

Over the medium term, growth is projected to gradually slow to about 3.5% by 2028 amid headwinds from weak productivity and population aging, Gopinath told a news conference to mark the release of the fund's "Article IV" review of China's economic policies.翻译:戈皮纳特在纪念该基金组织对中国经济政策的“第四条”审查发布的新闻发布会上表示，从中期来看，由于生产率疲软和人口老龄化带来的不利因素，预计到 2028 年，经济增长将逐渐放缓至 3.5% 左右。

China has introduced numerous measures to support the property market, but more is needed to secure a quicker recovery and lower economic costs to bring it down to a more sustainable size, she said.翻译:她表示，中国已经采取了多项措施来支持房地产市场，但还需要采取更多措施来确保更快的复苏和更低的经济成本，从而将房地产市场降至更可持续的规模。

"For the real estate sector, such a policy package will require accelerating the exit of non-viable property developers, removing impediments to housing price adjustment, and increasing central government funding for housing completion, among other measures," Gopinath said.翻译:戈皮纳特表示：“对于房地产行业来说，这样的一揽子政策将需要加快无生存能力的房地产开发商退出、消除房价调整障碍、增加中央政府对住房竣工的资金投入等措施。”

The combination of the downturn in the property sector and local government debt crunch could wipe out much of China's long-term growth potential, economists say.翻译:经济学家表示，房地产行业的低迷和地方政府债务紧缩的结合可能会消除中国的大部分长期增长潜力。

Local debt has reached 92 trillion yuan ($12.6 trillion), or 76% of China's economic output in 2022, up from 62.2% in 2019. China's Politburo, a top decision-making body of the ruling Communist Party, said in late July it would announce measures to reduce local government debt risks.翻译:地方债务已达到 92 万亿元人民币（12.6 万亿美元），占 2022 年中国经济产出的 76%，高于 2019 年的 62.2%。中国执政共产党的最高决策机构政治局在 7 月下旬表示，将出台化解地方政府债务风险的措施。

"The central government should implement coordinated fiscal framework reforms and balance-sheet restructuring to address local government debt strains, including closing local government fiscal gaps and controlling the flow of debt," said Gopinath.翻译:戈皮纳特表示：“中央政府应实施协调一致的财政框架改革和资产负债表重组，以解决地方政府债务紧张问题，包括缩小地方政府财政缺口和控制债务流向。”

China should also develop a comprehensive restructuring strategy to reduce the debt level of local government financing vehicles (LGFVs), she added.翻译:她补充说，中国还应该制定全面的重组战略，以降低地方政府融资平台（LGFV）的债务水平。

LGFVs were set up by local governments to fund infrastructure investment but now represent a major risk to China's slowing economy, with their combined debt ballooning to roughly $9 trillion.翻译:地方政府融资平台是地方政府为基础设施投资提供资金而设立的，但现在对中国经济放缓构成了重大风险，其债务总额激增至约9万亿美元。

"Improvements to local governments fiscal transparency and risk monitoring are necessary to prevent new vulnerabilities emerging, Gopinath warned, noting "financial stability risks are elevated and still rising."翻译:戈皮纳特警告说：“为了防止出现新的脆弱性，必须提高地方政府的财政透明度和风险监控，并指出“金融稳定风险正在上升，而且仍在上升。”

($1 = 7.2833 Chinese yuan renminbi)翻译:（1 美元 = 7.2833 人民币）

Reporting by Joe Cash and Ryan Woo; Editing by Edmund Klamann, Christopher Cushing, Shri Navaratnam & Simon Cameron-Moore翻译:乔·卡什 (Joe Cash) 和瑞安·吴 (Ryan Woo) 报道；编辑：Edmund Klamann、Christopher Cushing、Shri Navaratnam 和 Simon Cameron-Moore
item.author: Joe Cash, Ryan Woo

item.title: 华为计划如何在人工智能芯片业务上与英伟达竞争
item.description:
U.S. curbs on the sales of advanced artificial chips by Nvidia (NVDA.O) to China are creating an opening for Huawei to win market share, with sources saying it won a sizeable AI chip order from Chinese tech giant Baidu (9888.HK) this year.翻译:美国对英伟达（NVDA.O）向中国销售先进人工智能芯片的限制，为华为赢得市场份额创造了机会，有消息称，华为今年赢得了中国科技巨头百度（9888.HK）的巨额人工智能芯片订单。年。

Better known globally for its telecoms and smartphones businesses, Huawei has for the past four years been building an AI chip line.翻译:华为以其电信和智能手机业务而闻名于全球，过去四年来一直在打造人工智能芯片产品线。

Here is what we know about its Ascend AI chip series, and its main product to rival Nvidia's A100 chip, the 910B.

WHY AND HOW DID HUAWEI ENTER THE AI CHIP BUSINESS?

Huawei first unveiled its Ascend 910 in 2018 and the chip was officially launched in 2019 as part of a strategy to build a full-stack AI portfolio and become a provider of computing power. That same year, the company became the target of U.S. export controls.翻译:华为于2018年首次推出Ascend 910，并于2019年正式推出，作为打造全栈AI产品组合、成为算力提供商战略的一部分。同年，该公司成为美国出口管制的目标。

At the time, Huawei claimed that its chip was the world's most powerful AI processor and Chinese media reports said the original Ascend 910 was manufactured on a 7 nanometer process.翻译:当时，华为声称其芯片是世界上最强大的AI处理器，中国媒体报道称最初的Ascend 910是采用7纳米工艺制造的。

Huawei said the chip could deliver 256 TeraFLOPS for half-precision floating point (FP16) operations and 512 TeraOPS for integer precision calculations (INT8).翻译:华为表示，该芯片可以为半精度浮点（FP16）运算提供256 TeraFLOPS，为整数精度计算（INT8）提供512 TeraOPS。

The company also touted the chip's efficiency, saying that its max power consumption was 310W which it said had exceeded Huawei's original target at 350W.翻译:该公司还宣传了该芯片的效率，称其最大功耗为 310W，超过了华为最初设定的 350W 目标。

The chip, however, failed to dent Nvidia's dominance both inside and outside China. Nvidia introduced its A100 and H100 chips in 2020 and 2022 respectively which swept up the majority of the AI chip market share globally, a trend supercharged by the emergence of generative AI.翻译:然而，该芯片未能削弱英伟达在中国国内外的主导地位。 Nvidia 分别于 2020 年和 2022 年推出了 A100 和 H100 芯片，占据了全球 AI 芯片市场的大部分份额，这一趋势因生成式 AI 的出现而更加强劲。

Experts said Nvidia enjoyed a massive incumbent advantage over Huawei, with one key edge being the reliance of existing AI projects on Nvidia's software ecosystem. While Huawei has its own ecosystem version called CANN, analysts say it is much more limited in terms of the AI models it is capable of training.

WHAT IS THE LATEST CHIP, THE 910B?

Huawei has not officially announced the Ascend 910B, a newer version of the 910, but some details about the chip have emerged in public comments by some Chinese companies and academics, as well as in technical guides on Huawei's website.翻译:华为尚未正式发布 910 的更新版本 Ascend 910B，但有关该芯片的一些细节已经出现在一些中国公司和学者的公开评论中，以及华为网站上的技术指南中。

In August, the chairman of Chinese AI giant iFlyTek (002230.SZ), Liu Qingfeng, praised Huawei for producing a GPU that he said was "basically the same as Nvidia's A100" and said iFlyTek was working with Huawei to develop a hardware.翻译:8月，中国人工智能巨头科大讯飞（002230.SZ）董事长刘庆峰称赞华为生产的GPU“与Nvidia的A100基本相同”，并表示科大讯飞正在与华为合作开发硬件。

Chinese media outlet Yicai later reported that the hardware was powered by Ascend 910B, which had not been previously known.翻译:中国媒体第一财经随后报道称，该硬件由 Ascend 910B 驱动，但此前并不为人所知。

Reuters also found that documents related to Ascend 910B, such driver and firmware upgrade guides, started appearing on Huawei’s website this August.翻译:路透社还发现，与Ascend 910B相关的文档，例如驱动程序和固件升级指南，今年8月开始出现在华为网站上。

Last month, during iFlyTek's earnings call, Senior Vice President Jiang Tao once again said the Ascend 910B's capabilities were "comparable to Nvidia's A100".翻译:上个月，在科大讯飞的财报电话会议上，高级副总裁姜涛再次表示，Ascend 910B的性能“可与Nvidia的A100相媲美”。

Baidu ordered 1,600 of Huawei 910B chips for 200 servers in August, one source told Reuters.翻译:一位消息人士告诉路透社，百度在 8 月份为 200 台服务器订购了 1,600 颗华为 910B 芯片。

Analysts and sources say that the 910B chips are comparable to Nvidia's in terms of raw computing power, but they still lag behind in performance. Still, they are seen as the most sophisticated domestic option available in China.

WHY DOES THIS MATTER FOR HUAWEI AND CHINA?

Analysts have estimated China's AI chip market to be worth $7 billion and grabbing market share from Nvidia could mark a win for Huawei against the United States.翻译:分析师估计中国的人工智能芯片市场价值70亿美元，从英伟达手中夺取市场份额可能标志着华为战胜美国。

Huawei has reiterated how it wants to become a key provider of computing power for AI, with Chief Financial Officer Meng Wanzhou saying in September that Huawei wanted to build a computing base for China and give the world a "second option", in a veiled reference to dominant provider the United States.翻译:华为重申了如何成为人工智能计算能力的主要提供商，首席财务官孟晚舟在9月份表示，华为希望为中国建立一个计算基地，并给世界提供“第二选择”。到主要供应商美国。

In the absence of Nvidia chips, China's AI firms will have to rely on domestic products like Huawei's less powerful chips, but analysts say that it could be only a matter of time before Huawei is able to close this gap, given the amount of support and investment the Chinese government is pouring into AI and semiconductors.翻译:在没有英伟达芯片的情况下，中国的人工智能公司将不得不依赖国内产品，例如华为功能较弱的芯片，但分析人士表示，考虑到华为的支持力度和实力，华为能够缩小这一差距只是时间问题。中国政府正在大力投资人工智能和半导体。

Reporting by Josh Ye; Editing by Brenda Goh and Miral Fahmy翻译:乔希·叶报道；编辑：Brenda Goh 和 Miral Fahmy
item.author: Josh Ye

item.title: 独家：百度向华为下达AI芯片订单，不再向英伟达订购
item.description:
Baidu (9888.HK) ordered artificial intelligence chips from Huawei (HWT.UL) this year, two people familiar with the matter said, adding to signs that U.S. pressure is prompting Chinese acceptance of the firm's products as an alternative to Nvidia's.翻译:两位知情人士表示，百度（9888.HK）今年向华为（HWT.UL）订购了人工智能芯片，这进一步表明美国的压力正在促使中国接受该公司的产品作为英伟达产品的替代品。

One of the people said Baidu, one of China's leading AI firms, which operates the Ernie large language model (LLM), placed the order in August, ahead of widely anticipated new rules by the U.S. government that in October tightened restrictions on exports of chips and chip tools to China, including those of U.S. chip giant Nvidia (NVDA.O).翻译:其中一位知情人士表示，运营Ernie大语言模型 (LLM) 的中国领先人工智能公司之一的百度于 8 月下达了订单，早于广泛预期的美国政府 10 月收紧芯片出口限制的新规定以及向中国出口芯片工具，包括美国芯片巨头英伟达（NVDA.O）的工具。

Baidu ordered 1,600 of Huawei Technologies' 910B Ascend AI chips - which the Chinese firm developed as an alternative to Nvidia's A100 chip - for 200 servers, the source said, adding that by October, Huawei had delivered more 60% of the order, or about 1,000 chips, to Baidu.翻译:消息人士称，百度为 200 台服务器订购了 1,600 颗华为技术公司的 910B Ascend AI 芯片（该芯片是这家中国公司开发的，作为 Nvidia A100 芯片的替代品），并补充说，到 10 月份，华为已交付了超过 60% 的订单，即大约 60%。 1000块筹码，去百度。

The second person said that the order's total value was approximately 450 million yuan ($61.83 million) and that Huawei was to deliver all of the chips by the end of this year. Both people declined to be named because the details of the deal were confidential.翻译:第二位人士表示，该订单总价值约为4.5亿元人民币（6183万美元），华为将在今年年底前交付所有芯片。由于交易细节保密，两人均拒绝透露姓名。

Although the order is tiny relative to the thousands of chips top Chinese tech firms have historically ordered from Nvidia, the sources said it was significant, as it showed how some firms could shift away from the U.S. company.翻译:尽管与中国顶级科技公司历史上从英伟达订购的数千个芯片相比，这笔订单规模很小，但消息人士表示，这一订单意义重大，因为它表明一些公司可能会放弃这家美国公司。

Baidu, alongside Chinese peers such as Tencent (0700.HK) and Alibaba (9988.HK), is known to be a long-time client of Nvidia. Baidu was not previously known to be a AI chip customer of Huawei.翻译:众所周知，百度以及腾讯（0700.HK）和阿里巴巴（9988.HK）等中国同行都是英伟达的长期客户。此前并不知道百度是华为的AI芯片客户。

Although Huawei's Ascend chips are still seen as far inferior to Nvidia's in terms of performance, the first source said they were the most sophisticated domestic option available in China.翻译:尽管华为的 Ascend 芯片在性能方面仍被认为远远不如 Nvidia 的芯片，但第一位消息人士表示，它们是中国最先进的国产芯片。

"They were ordering 910B chips to prepare for a future where they may no longer be able to purchase from Nvidia," the first source said.翻译:第一位消息人士称：“他们订购 910B 芯片是为了应对未来可能无法再从 Nvidia 购买的情况。”

Baidu and Huawei did not respond to requests for comment. Nvidia declined to comment.翻译:百度和华为没有回应置评请求。英伟达拒绝置评。

Huawei's website says it has since 2020 collaborated with Baidu to make its AI platform compatible with Huawei hardware. In August, the two companies said they would deepen compatibility between Baidu’s Ernie AI model and Huawei’s Ascend chips.翻译:华为网站称，自2020年以来，该公司已与百度合作，使其AI平台与华为硬件兼容。今年8月，两家公司表示将加深百度Ernie AI模型与华为Ascend芯片之间的兼容性。

Baidu has developed its own line of Kunlun AI chips, which the company says supports large-scale AI computing, but the company has mainly relied on Nvidia's A100 chip to train its LLM.翻译:百度开发了自己的昆仑AI芯片系列，该公司称该芯片支持大规模AI计算，但该公司主要依靠Nvidia的A100芯片来训练其LLM。

After the U.S. last year imposed rules stopping Nvidia from selling its A100 and H100 chips to China, the company issued new A800 and H800 chips as alternatives for Chinese customers, including Baidu. Nvidia is no longer able to sell those chips to China because of the October rules.

HUAWEI OPPORTUNITY

Analysts predicted last month that the U.S. curbs would create an opening for Huawei to expand in its $7 billion home market. The company has been the subject of U.S. export controls since 2019.翻译:分析师上个月预测，美国的限制将为华为在其 70 亿美元的国内市场扩张创造机会。自2019年以来，该公司一直受到美国出口管制。

The order adds to signs of technological advances for Huawei, as Beijing pours investment into its domestic semiconductor industry to help it catch up with overseas peers and urges state-owned firms to replace foreign technology with domestic alternatives.翻译:该命令增加了华为技术进步的迹象，因为北京方面对其国内半导体行业进行了大量投资，以帮助其赶上海外同行，并敦促国有企业用国内技术替代外国技术。

Huawei drew substantial global attention in August when it unexpectedly unveiled a new smartphone that analysts said uses internally developed processors featuring advanced semiconductor technology, highlighting the company's progress in chip development despite sanctions.翻译:华为在八月份出人意料地推​​出了一款新智能手机，引起了全球的广泛关注，分析师称该智能手机采用了采用先进半导体技术的内部开发处理器，突显该公司尽管受到制裁，但在芯片开发方面取得了进展。

In September, Reuters reported that Huawei's in-house chip design unit, HiSilicon, had commenced shipments of newly developed Chinese-made processors for surveillance cameras to clients in 2023 in another comeback sign.翻译:9 月，路透社报道称，华为内部芯片设计部门海思半导体已于 2023 年开始向客户发货新开发的中国制造的监控摄像头处理器，这是另一个卷土重来的迹象。

($1 = 7.2782 Chinese yuan renminbi)翻译:（1 美元 = 7.2782 人民币）

Reporting by Yelin Mo, Zhang Yan and Brenda Goh; Additional reporting by Josh Ye in Hong Kong; Editing by Gerry Doyle翻译:莫叶琳、张岩、Brenda Goh 报道； Josh Ye 在香港的补充报道；格里·多伊尔编辑
item.author: Reuters

item.title: 丰田延长中国合资公司减产期限以缓解经销商压力
item.description:
Japan's Toyota Motor (7203.T) has told dealers that it will extend a plan to reduce output at one of its joint ventures in China, where it faces rising competition.翻译:日本丰田汽车（7203.T）告诉经销商，该公司将延长其在中国一家合资企业的减产计划，该公司在中国面临着日益激烈的竞争。

The cut, which was initially for October and November, will be extended by three months, Toyota's joint venture with China's state-owned FAW Group (SASACJ.UL) said in a letter dated Nov. 3, which was seen by Reuters and verified with one of the dealers.翻译:丰田与中国国有一汽集团的合资企业 (SASACJ.UL) 在 11 月 3 日的一封信中表示，原定于 10 月和 11 月实施的降价将延长三个月。路透社看到了该信，并与经销商之一。

Its aim is to ease inventory pressure on dealers and ensure they can operate well in the "severe market environment".翻译:其目的是缓解经销商的库存压力，确保他们能够在“严峻的市场环境”下良好运营。

"Production from December to February next year will continue to be reduced by a large amount," FAW Toyota said.翻译:“12月至明年2月的产量将继续大幅减少”，一汽丰田表示。

As a result, car sales to Toyota dealers would be reduced to 66,000 units in December, 60,000 units in January and 38,000 units in February, it added in the letter.翻译:因此，丰田经销商的汽车销量将在 12 月减少至 66,000 辆，1 月减少至 60,000 辆，2 月减少至 38,000 辆。

Toyota declined to comment on its production or the letter.翻译:丰田拒绝就其生产或这封信发表评论。

While Toyota has avoided the kind of hit other Japanese automakers such as Nissan Motor (7201.T) Honda Motor (7267.T) have taken in China from a shift to electric vehicles and the rise of domestic brands, it still faces pressure in the world's biggest auto market.翻译:尽管丰田避免了日产汽车（7201.T） 、本田汽车（7267.T）等其他日本汽车制造商在中国因转向电动汽车和国产品牌崛起而遭受的那种打击，但它仍然面临着来自汽车制造商的压力。全球最大的汽车市场。

Chinese rivals such as BYD (002594.SZ) have been gaining market share, with plug-in hybrids and pure electric cars at competitive prices.翻译:比亚迪（002594.SZ）等中国竞争对手一直在凭借具有竞争力的价格的插电式混合动力车和纯电动汽车赢得市场份额。

In July, Toyota also terminated early the contracts of about 1,000 dispatch workers at its joint venture with Guangzhou Automobile Group (GAC) (601238.SS), due to production levels.翻译:7月份，丰田还因生产水平问题提前终止了与广汽集团（601238.SS）合资企业约1,000名派遣工的合同。

Toyota, ranked third in sales after BYD and Volkswagen in China, sold 1.265 million cars to dealers in the first nine months, data from China Association of Automobile Manufacturers showed, down 9% from the same period a year ago.翻译:中国汽车工业协会的数据显示，丰田汽车在中国销量排名第三，仅次于比亚迪和大众，今年前九个月向经销商销售了126.5万辆汽车，同比下降9%。

The CAAM data does not include imported cars.翻译:CAAM数据不包括进口汽车。

By comparison, BYD's sales rose more than 60% in the period.翻译:相比之下，比亚迪的销量同期增长超过60%。

Reporting by Zhang Yan, Brenda Goh; Additional reporting by Daniel Leussink in Tokyo; Editing by Alexander Smith翻译:张岩、Brenda Goh 报道； Daniel Leussink 在东京的补充报道；亚历山大·史密斯编辑
item.author: Reuters

item.title: 随着全球需求下降，中国字节跳动将重组 VR 部门 Pico——消息人士
item.description:
Summary:
  • Pico to cut jobs with 'hundreds' of staff to be affected-sources
  • ByteDance has pared back efforts to develop Pico brand-sources
  • Multiple senior managers have left Pico this year-source
翻译:概括：
  • 笔克将裁员，“数百名”员工将受到影响-消息人士
  • 字节跳动减少了开发 Pico 品牌资源的力度
  • 今年有多位高级管理人员离开笔克-消息来源

ByteDance's virtual reality (VR) arm Pico will cut jobs and undertake its biggest overhaul since it was acquired by the TikTok maker two years ago as global demand for VR headsets weakens, three people with direct knowledge of the matter said.翻译:三名知情人士表示，由于全球对 VR 头显的需求减弱，字节跳动旗下虚拟现实 (VR) 部门 Pico 将进行裁员，并进行自两年前被 TikTok 收购以来最大规模的改革。

China-based Pico held an internal meeting on Tuesday announcing the unit would keep its hardware team, but much of its software team would be folded back into ByteDance's own product development team, the people told Reuters on condition of anonymity because they were not authorised to speak publicly.翻译:知情人士向路透透露，总部位于中国的笔克周二举行了一次内部会议，宣布该部门将保留其硬件团队，但其大部分软件团队将并入字节跳动自己的产品开发团队。公开发言。

At the meeting, Pico's CEO Zhou Hongwei said "the VR industry remains in a very early stage" and the company's "estimation for the industry and market growth was too optimistic as (real growth) did not go as fast as expected," acording to a transcript of his speech verified by two of the sources.翻译:会上，Pico首席执行官周宏伟表示，“VR行业仍处于非常早期的阶段”，公司“对行业和市场增长的估计过于乐观，（实际增长）没有达到预期”。经两位消息人士证实的他的演讲笔录。

Zhou also said that the company would lay off staff from its sales, videos and platform operation teams.翻译:周还表示，公司将裁减销售、视频和平台运营团队的人员。

The meeting did not specify how many jobs would be cut, but the three people said "hundreds" of staff were expected to be affected globally.翻译:会议没有具体说明将裁员多少人，但三人表示，预计全球“数百名”员工将受到影响。

Pico said in a statement it was restructuring the business to focus more on hardware and core technologies, but declined to comment on possible job cuts.翻译:笔克在一份声明中表示，正在重组业务，以更多地关注硬件和核心技术，但拒绝就可能的裁员发表评论。

The reorganisation is a setback for ByteDance as its 2021 acquisition of Pico, which valued the VR company at more than $1 billion, was seen as the Chinese group's attempt to take on Meta Platform's (META.O) Quest line of VR headsets.翻译:这次重组对字节跳动来说是一次挫折，因为字节跳动在 2021 年收购了 Pico，这家 VR 公司的估值超过 10 亿美元，被视为这家中国集团试图挑战 Meta Platform (META.O) Quest VR 耳机系列。

However, VR demand has sputtered this year. Augmented reality (AR) and VR headset shipments have fallen for the last four consecutive quarters, according to data from research firm IDC ended June 30, with volumes down 44.6% in the second quarter year-on-year.翻译:然而，今年 VR 需求却出现了下滑。研究公司 IDC 截至 6 月 30 日的数据显示，增强现实 (AR) 和 VR 耳机出货量连续四个季度下降，第二季度销量同比下降 44.6%。

Since the acquisition, Pico has been aggressively expanding both inside and outside China. In China, it has become the leading VR producer by total shipments and globally it trails only Meta.翻译:自收购以来，笔克一直在中国境内外积极扩张。在中国，按总出货量计算，它已成为领先的 VR 生产商，在全球范围内，它仅落后于 Meta。

But two of the people said ByteDance had pared back efforts to develop Pico as a brand in recent months as the outlook dimmed. A number of senior managers have left Pico this year, one of the people added.翻译:但其中两位人士表示，由于前景黯淡，字节跳动近几个月已经减少了将 Pico 发展为品牌的努力。其中一位知情人士补充说，今年有多位高级管理人员离开了笔克。

ByteDance declined to comment on the change of Pico's position as a strategic priority within the company and the senior personnel changes.翻译:字节跳动拒绝就Pico在公司内部战略优先地位的变化以及高级人事变动发表评论。

ByteDance said last month it remained committed to the VR industry in the long term following media reports that it planned to gradually wind down Pico.翻译:字节跳动上个月表示，在有媒体报道计划逐步关闭 Pico 后，字节跳动仍将长期致力于VR 行业。

Reporting by Josh Ye; Editing by Jamie Freed and Kim Coghill翻译:乔希·叶报道；编辑：杰米·弗里德和金·科吉尔
item.author: Josh Ye

item.title: 中国进口意外增长
item.description:
China's imports unexpectedly grew in October while exports contracted at a quicker pace, in a mixed set of indicators that showed the world's second-largest economy facing persistent risks despite a recent improvement in domestic demand.翻译:中国10月份进口意外增长，而出口则以更快的速度收缩，一系列混合指标显示，尽管近期内需有所改善，但世界第二大经济体仍面临持续风险。

The trade figures follow a run of mostly upbeat data that showed Beijing's support measures have helped bolster a tentative comeback, although a protracted property crisis and soft global demand continue to dog policymakers heading into 2024.翻译:贸易数据公布之前，一系列基本乐观的数据显示，北京的支持措施帮助推动了经济的初步复苏，尽管旷日持久的房地产危机和疲软的全球需求继续困扰着政策制定者，进入 2024 年。

Exports shrank 6.4% from a year earlier in October, customs data showed on Tuesday, faster than a 6.2% decline in September and worse than a 3.3% fall expected in a Reuters poll. Imports rose 3.0%, dashing forecasts for a 4.8% contraction and swinging from a 6.2% fall in September. Imports snapped 11 straight months of decline.翻译:周二海关数据显示，10 月份出口同比萎缩 6.4%，高于 9 月份 6.2% 的降幅，也低于路透调查预期的 3.3% 降幅。进口增长 3.0%，远超预期的收缩 4.8%，且与 9 月份的下降 6.2% 持平。进口结束了连续 11 个月的下降。

"The figures are in contrast to market expectations. The bad exports data may hit market confidence as we had expected the supply chain of exports to recover," said Zhou Hao, economist at Guotai Junan International.翻译:国泰君安国际经济学家周浩表示：“这些数据与市场预期相反。糟糕的出口数据可能会打击市场信心，因为我们原本预计出口供应链将恢复。”

"The significant improvement in imports may come from rising domestic demand, in particular a demand to replenish stocks."

UNEVEN RECOVERY

The yuan and Chinese stocks fell following the data, which reinforced markets' continued concerns about a fragile and uneven recovery.翻译:数据公布后，人民币和中国股市下跌，加剧了市场对脆弱且不平衡复苏的持续担忧。

China's official purchasing managers' index last week showed both new export and import orders shrank for an eighth consecutive month in October, suggesting manufacturers are struggling for buyers overseas and ordering fewer components.翻译:中国官方采购经理人指数上周显示，10月份新出口和进口订单连续第八个月萎缩，这表明制造商正在为海外买家而苦苦挣扎，零部件订单也减少。

"Since the global electronics market is on the rise, as affirmed by South Korea and Vietnam's export performance, China's poor export data points to weak demand in other categories, such as Christmas goods and garments," said Xu Tianchen, senior economist at the Economist Intelligence Unit.翻译:《经济学人》高级经济学家徐天辰表示：“正如韩国和越南的出口表现所证实的那样，全球电子市场正在增长，中国糟糕的出口数据表明圣诞节商品和服装等其他类别的需求疲软。”情报单位。

"The positive surprise on imports seems to reflect a firming up in domestic demand, rather than deriving from distortions caused by the one-time bulk buying of commodities," he added.翻译:“进口的积极惊喜似乎反映了国内需求的坚挺，而不是源于一次性大宗商品购买造成的扭曲，”他补充道。

China imported 13.52% more crude oil in October from a year earlier, a marginal increase on September's growth. Soybean imports jumped 25% from a year earlier, as the surge in cheap and plentiful shipments from Brazil continued.翻译:10月份中国原油进口量同比增加13.52%，较9月份略有增长。由于来自巴西的廉价且充足的出口量持续激增，大豆进口量同比增长 25%。

Trade with China's major peers continued to contract, with exports to Southeast Asia, its largest trade partner, down 15.1%.翻译:与中国主要同行的贸易继续萎缩，其中对最大贸易伙伴东南亚的出口下降15.1%。

Trade with Australia was the exception amid improving relations between Beijing and Canberra, cooling diplomatic tensions that had arisen in recent years over a host of issues including national security and COVID. China has in recent months lowered trade barriers on Australian barley and wine exports.翻译:在北京和堪培拉关系改善、缓解近年来因国家安全和新冠疫情等一系列问题而出现的外交紧张局势的背景下，与澳大利亚的贸易是个例外。近几个月来，中国降低了对澳大利亚大麦和葡萄酒出口的贸易壁垒。

Exports to Australia rose 5.9% in October while imports from the resource-rich nation climbed 12.0%.翻译:10 月份对澳大利亚的出口增长 5.9%，而从资源丰富的国家的进口增长 12.0%。

China's higher imports narrowed the overall trade surplus to $56.53 billion in October from $77.71 billion in September, missing a forecast of $82.00 billion.翻译:中国进口增加使10月份整体贸易顺差从9月份的777.1亿美元缩小至565.3亿美元，低于预期的820亿美元。

Analysts say it is too early to tell whether recent policy support will be enough to shore up domestic demand, with property, unemployment and weak household and business confidence threatening to undermine a sustainable rebound.翻译:分析师表示，现在判断近期的政策支持是否足以提振内需还为时过早，因为房地产、失业以及疲软的家庭和企业信心可能会破坏经济的可持续反弹。

China's manufacturing activity unexpectedly contracted in October, data showed last week, complicating policymakers' efforts to revive growth.翻译:上周数据显示，中国十月份制造业活动意外收缩，使政策制定者恢复增长的努力变得更加复杂。

"Measures of foreign orders hint at a more significant drop in foreign demand than what has so far been observed in the customs data," said Julian Evans-Pritchard, head of China Economics at Capital Economics.翻译:凯投宏观(Capital Economics)中国经济主管朱利安·埃文斯-普里查德(Julian Evans-Pritchard)表示：“外国订单指标表明，外国需求下降幅度比迄今为止海关数据中观察到的下降幅度更大。”

"We expect most advanced economies to experience either mild recessions or weak GDP growth in the near-term, which will weigh on their demand for foreign goods."翻译:“我们预计大多数发达经济体短期内将经历温和衰退或GDP增长疲软，这将影响他们对外国商品的需求。”

Reporting by Joe Cash and Ellen Zhang. Editing by Sam Holmes翻译:乔·卡什和艾伦·张报道。山姆·霍姆斯编辑
item.author: Joe Cash

item.title: “中国计划”媒体公司因资金问题关闭
item.description:
One of the few independently funded English-language publications to cover China in depth for Western audiences, "The China Project", is to close because of a lack of funding, its editor-in-chief, Jeremy Goldkorn, wrote in a post.翻译:《中国计划》是为数不多的为西方读者深入报道中国的独立资助英文出版物之一，其主编杰里米·戈德科恩(Jeremy Goldkorn)在一篇文章中写道，由于缺乏资金，该出版物即将关闭。

The China Project, which began as a newsletter in 2016 and was formerly known as SupChina, expanded to become a "news and business intelligence company focused on helping a global audience understand China", it says on its website.翻译:中国项目在其网站上表示，该项目始于 2016 年，最初是一份时事通讯，前身为 SupChina，现已扩展成为一家“专注于帮助全球受众了解中国的新闻和商业情报公司”。

Its products included the popular China news and society-themed Sinica podcast, articles on a wide range of China-themed topics on its website, a business intelligence data product "ChinaEDGE" and organising conferences.翻译:其产品包括热门的中国新闻和社会主题的《Sinica》播客、网站上有关各种中国主题的文章、商业智能数据产品“ChinaEDGE”以及组织会议。

Staff numbers increased too. But as with a number of online-based media companies in recent years, such as Buzzfeed News, financing became a problem.翻译:员工人数也增加了。但与近年来许多网络媒体公司（例如 Buzzfeed News）一样，融资成为了一个问题。

"The media business is precarious," Goldkorn wrote in a statement on the website.翻译:“媒体业务岌岌可危，”金科恩在网站上的一份声明中写道。

"This week, we learned that a source of funding that we had been counting on was no longer going to come through, and we have had to make the difficult decision to close down."翻译:“本周，我们得知我们一直指望的资金来源不再可用，我们不得不做出关闭的艰难决定。”

The company sought to produce "balanced" reporting on China and U.S.-China-themed topics. But this attracted criticism as relations between the two powers sank to new depths.翻译:该公司力求就中国和中美主题话题进行“平衡”的报道。但随着两国关系跌入新的深度，此举招致批评。

"We have been accused many times in both countries of working for nefarious purposes for the government of the other," Goldkorn said.翻译:戈德科恩说：“我们在两国都多次被指控为对方政府从事邪恶目的。”

"Defending ourselves has incurred enormous legal costs, and, far worse, made it increasingly difficult for us to attract investors, advertisers, and sponsors. While our subscription offerings have been growing strongly and steadily, we are not yet in a position to rely on these revenues to sustain our operations."翻译:“为自己辩护带来了巨大的法律成本，更糟糕的是，使我们越来越难以吸引投资者、广告商和赞助商。虽然我们的订阅服务一直强劲而稳定地增长，但我们还无法依赖这些收入可以维持我们的运营。”

Media companies globally have had mixed success with subscription models.翻译:全球媒体公司在订阅模式方面取得了不同程度的成功。

The China Project's subscription package offered "the internet's best birds-eye view of China" for $120 a year, which was still on offer to site visitors on Tuesday, according to a Reuters check.翻译:据路透社报道，中国项目的订阅套餐以每年 120 美元的价格提供“互联网上最好的中国鸟瞰图”，该套餐周二仍在向网站访问者提供。

"We do not have a business model problem," company CEO Bob Guterma told Reuters via email.翻译:“我们不存在商业模式问题，”公司首席执行官鲍勃·古特玛通过电子邮件告诉路透社。

"We made big plans and pursued them boldly with the full backing of our investors. But in the past six months, investor interest has dropped off precipitously due to economic and geopolitical headwinds. We became unable to sustain what we had grown into."翻译:“我们制定了宏伟的计划，并在投资者的全力支持下大胆地实现它们。但在过去的六个月里，由于经济和地缘政治的逆风，投资者的兴趣急剧下降。我们变得无法维持我们的发展。”

Reporting by Martin Quin Pollard, additional reporting by Laurie Chen, Casey Hall, Brenda Goh ; editing by Robert Birsel翻译:Martin Quin Pollard 报道，Laurie Chen、Casey Hall、Brenda Goh 补充报道；罗伯特·伯塞尔编辑
item.author: Martin Pollard

item.title: WeWork中国不会参与WeWork战略重组
item.description:
WeWork China will not participate in the strategic reorganisation of WeWork (WE.N) in the United States and Canada, it said on Tuesday.翻译:周二，WeWork 中国表示，不会参与 WeWork （WE.N）在美国和加拿大的战略重组。

WeWork China is not a branch or unit of WeWork (WE.N), it said in a statement on WeChat, adding the company has independent operations and management capabilities.翻译:该公司在微信上发表声明称，WeWork中国并非WeWork （WE.N）的分支机构或单位，并补充说公司具有独立的运营和管理能力。

WeWork, the SoftBank Group (9984.T)-backed startup, sought U.S. bankruptcy protection on Monday, after its bets on companies using more of its office-sharing space soured.翻译:软银集团(9984.T)支持的初创公司 WeWork 在押注更多使用其办公共享空间的公司失败后，于周一寻求美国破产保护。

"Any operating conditions of WeWork in other regions around the world will not have any impact on WeWork China," it added.翻译:“WeWork在全球其他地区的任何运营情况不会对WeWork中国产生任何影响，”它补充道。

Reporting by Ella Cao, Albee Zhang and Ryan Woo; Editing by Christian Schmollinger翻译:Ella Cao、Albee 张和 Ryan Woo 报道；克里斯蒂安·施莫林格编辑
item.author: Reuters

item.title: 独家：中国罕见的货币市场困境背后的优先事项相互冲突
item.description:
China's attempts to keep the yuan from falling contributed to last week's chaos in money markets, sources involved say, pointing to the pressure behind the scenes as Beijing tries to guide its economy and markets through a major slowdown.翻译:相关消息人士称，中国试图阻止人民币贬值，导致了上周货币市场的混乱，并指出了北京试图引导经济和市场度过大幅放缓之际的幕后压力。

Routine month-end demand for cash in China's banking system snowballed into a scramble on Oct. 31 that pushed short-term funding rates as high as 50% in some cases, an incident that authorities are now investigating.翻译:10月31日，中国银行系统月末例行的现金需求如滚雪球般加剧，导致短期融资利率在某些情况下高达50%，当局目前正在调查这一事件。

Six participants in the market say a confluence of factors drove fear and confusion across trading rooms in Shanghai and Beijing by late afternoon on that day.翻译:六名市场参与者表示，截至当天下午晚些时候，多种因素的综合作用在上海和北京的交易室中引发了恐惧和混乱。

Eventually, the People's Bank of China (PBOC), its affiliated China Foreign Exchange Trade System (CFETS) and bond clearing houses stepped in, directing lenders, extending trading hours and holding meetings with institutions to calm markets.翻译:最终，中国人民银行（PBOC）、其下属的中国外汇交易中心（CFETS）和债券清算所介入，指导贷款机构、延长交易时间并与机构召开会议以安抚市场。

The contributing factors were the usual month-end demand for liquidity, cash hoarding in the lead up to a big government bond sale and a market where the biggest banks were already reticent to lend because of a mandate to counter pressure on the yuan.翻译:促成因素包括通常的月底流动性需求、大规模政府债券发行前的现金囤积，以及市场上最大的银行因受制于应对人民币压力的任务而不愿放贷。

"It was an accident," said Xia Chun, chief economist at wealth manager Yintech Investment Holdings, calling it an unforeseen consequence of the government's heavy hand in financial markets.翻译:财富管理公司银科投资控股有限公司首席经济学家夏春表示，“这是一次意外”，他称这是政府对金融市场的大力干预造成的不可预见的后果。

"Banks were grudging in lending, leaving non-banks asking each other for money in afternoon trade," he said. "Borrowing rates surged as a result, with some willing to take any price."翻译:“银行在放贷方面不情愿，导致非银行机构在下午的交易中互相要钱，”他说。 “借贷利率因此飙升，有些人愿意不惜一切代价。”

The reasons for the spike in interest rates and the ensuing market chaos are detailed here for the first time. Participants say that the vulnerability exposed will stay as long as capital outflows keep the system under pressure.翻译:这里首次详述了利率飙升和随之而来的市场混乱的原因。参与者表示，只要资本外流使系统承受压力，暴露的脆弱性就会持续存在。

Most of them requested anonymity as they were not authorised to discuss a sensitive topic publicly.翻译:他们中的大多数人要求匿名，因为他们无权公开讨论敏感话题。

The PBOC told Reuters that CFETS was probing "abnormal" trades on Oct. 31 involving some accounts repeatedly borrowing and lending money at "extremely high interest rates" near the end of trading hours.

'COMBAT MOOD'

Short-term financing markets, such as overnight repurchase agreements, or repos, are crucial to the daily business of banks, insurers and other financial institutions.翻译:隔夜回购协议等短期融资市场对于银行、保险公司和其他金融机构的日常业务至关重要。

They affect foreign exchange movements since the markets are the major avenue for the supply of money.翻译:它们影响外汇变动，因为市场是货币供应的主要渠道。

Funds and non-banks borrow and roll over loans that finance their investments and trades in the repo market. The month-end is also when banks and other finance-sector participants have to square their books and comply with rules on capital buffers.翻译:基金和非银行机构借入并展期贷款，为其在回购市场上的投资和交易提供资金。月底也是银行和其他金融部门参与者必须整理账目并遵守资本缓冲规则的时候。

Disruptions, therefore, can threaten financial stability.翻译:因此，混乱可能会威胁金融稳定。

Seeds of trouble were sown in October when China approved one trillion yuan ($137.32 billion) in sovereign debt sales, to be rolled out - according to sources familiar with the plans - by sticking to the issuance schedule for the fourth quarter but increasing the size of each tranche.翻译:据知情人士透露，10 月份中国批准发行 1 万亿元人民币（合 1,373.2 亿美元）的主权债务，此举埋下了麻烦的种子。每个批次。

Typically, said one fund manager in Shanghai, in such situations the PBOC would offset the cash drain from the extra bond issuance with extra funding support - for example by relaxing bank reserve requirements.翻译:上海的一位基金经理表示，通常情况下，在这种情况下，中国人民银行会通过额外的资金支持来抵消额外发行债券造成的现金流失，例如放宽银行准备金要求。

But putting extra cash into the system would risk adding downward pressure on the yuan - which has lost over 5% against the dollar this year - and undercut months of efforts to stabilise the currency.翻译:但向该体系注入额外现金可能会增加人民币贬值的风险——人民币兑美元汇率今年已贬值超过5%——并削弱数月来稳定人民币汇率的努力。

"The inaction by the central bank is mainly due to its concern over yuan depreciation," said the fund manager, who declined to be identified as he was not authorised to talk to media.翻译:“央行不作为主要是因为担心人民币贬值，”该基金经理表示。由于无权接受媒体采访，该基金经理拒绝透露姓名。

On trading floors that Tuesday, the scramble for short-term funds became a stampede.翻译:那周二的交易大厅里，短期资金的争夺变成了踩踏事件。

Even repo rates between banks, normally stable and the main gauge of short-term funding costs, flew from an overnight rate of 2% a day earlier to as high as 8% on Oct. 31.

DESPERATE BORROWERS

At 4 p.m. (0800 GMT) the state banks that normally lend to desperate last-minute borrowers were missing, according to three market participants.翻译:据三名市场参与者称，下午 4 点（格林威治标准时间 0800），通常向绝望的最后一刻借款人提供贷款的国有银行失踪了。

The absence left a couple of desperate borrowers paying 30%-50% - rates not seen since defaults at China Everbright Bank (601818.SS) and Industrial bank Co Ltd (601166.SS) a decade ago - to secure the loans they needed.翻译:由于缺席，一些绝望的借款人支付了30%-50%的利率——自十年前中国光大银行(601818.SS)和兴业银行股份有限公司(601166.SS)违约以来从未见过的利率——以获得他们所需的贷款。

At 5 p.m. markets closed with positions unfunded and trades incomplete.翻译:下午 5 点，市场收盘，持仓资金不足，交易未完成。

"No one left the trading desk, as you don't know how things will go ... the whole trading room was in combat mood," said one fund manager in Beijing.翻译:北京一位基金经理表示：“没有人离开交易柜台，因为你不知道事情会如何发展……整个交易室都处于战斗情绪中。”

"If you need to square your positions in such an environment, and want to avoid default, you need to borrow at high rates," the fund manager said. "For each individual, it's rational behaviour."翻译:“如果你需要在这样的环境下平仓，并希望避免违约，你需要以高利率借款，”该基金经理表示。 “对于每个人来说，这是理性行为。”

The PBOC stepped into the breach, asking state banks to supply funds while the China Central Depository & Clearing Co (CCDC) and Shanghai Clearing House both reopened settlements at 6 p.m in an emergency response. By 8.30 p.m., crisis was averted and the market cleared and closed again.

DO NOT 'BE EMOTIONAL'

At a follow-up meeting with banks and brokers the next day, sources said the PBOC told institutions their behaviour was "disturbing the market" and that they should not "be emotional."翻译:在第二天与银行和经纪商举行的后续会议上，消息人士称，中国人民银行告诉机构，他们的行为“扰乱市场”，他们不应该“情绪激动”。

The money market operator CFETS told traders to keep a 5% ceiling on repo transactions and said anyone involved in high-rate deals closed on Oct. 31 would need to explain themselves to regulators, according to sources who received the notice.翻译:据收到通知的消息人士称，货币市场运营商 CFETS 要求交易员对回购交易保持 5% 的上限，并表示任何参与 10 月 31 日结束的高利率交易的人都需要向监管机构作出解释。

Fear subsided with overnight rates falling back below 3%. To be sure, most see the danger as having passed.翻译:随着隔夜利率回落至 3% 以下，恐慌情绪逐渐消退。可以肯定的是，大多数人认为危险已经过去。

But analysts have turned to the backdrop - intensifying control over China's currency - as an underlying source of tension.翻译:但分析人士已将加强对人民币汇率的控制视为紧张局势的潜在根源。

China's economic rebound from the COVID-19 pandemic has been a disappointment. Together with rate rises around the world, it has fanned capital outflows and the yuan has suffered.翻译:中国经济从新冠肺炎 (COVID-19) 大流行中复苏的情况令人失望。加上全球范围内的加息，加剧了资本外流，人民币也受到影响。

And yet, after dropping 5% on the dollar over the year to mid-August, the exchange rate has been conspicuously steady since as efforts from state-bank buying to new rules discouraging short selling have been deployed to support it.翻译:然而，截至 8 月中旬，美元兑美元汇率在一年内下跌 5% 后，此后随着国家银行购买行为和禁止卖空的新规则等措施的出台，该汇率一直明显稳定。

Tighter liquidity is another method.翻译:收紧流动性是另一种方法。

"If the pattern of money supply and liquidity provision remains unchanged, the whole system remains fragile. Another liquidity shock is always possible," said the Beijing-based fund manager.翻译:“如果货币供应和流动性供给的模式保持不变，整个体系仍然脆弱。另一场流动性冲击总是有可能的，”这位驻北京的基金经理表示。

Others see less risk, but expect tightness will stay as long as there is pressure on the currency. Broad dollar weakness has helped the yuan lately, but at 7.28 to the dollar it is not far from September's 16-year low of 7.351.翻译:其他人则认为风险较小，但预计只要货币面临压力，紧缩状况就会持续下去。美元普遍疲软最近对人民币汇率有所帮助，但人民币兑美元汇率为 7.28，距离 9 月份的 16 年低点 7.351 不远。

($1 = 7.2822 Chinese yuan)翻译:（1 美元 = 7.2822 人民币）

Reporting by Shanghai Newsroom Writing by Tom Westbrook; Editing by Vidya Ranganathan and Raju Gopalakrishnan翻译:上海新闻编辑室的报道，汤姆·威斯布鲁克撰文；编辑：Vidya Ranganathan 和 Raju Gopalakrishnan
item.author: Reuters

item.title: 黑龙江省健身馆倒塌事故已造成3人死亡
item.description:
Three people were killed and one injured after a structural collapse at a fitness club in northeast China's Heilongjiang province, local officials said on Tuesday.翻译:当地官员周二表示，中国东北黑龙江省一健身俱乐部发生结构倒塌事故，造成三人死亡、一人受伤。

Government officials and state media said seven people were in the Yuecheng Fitness Gymnasium in Jiamusi city, Huanan County, when it collapsed late on Monday.翻译:政府官员和官方媒体称，周一晚间，桦南县佳木斯市悦城健身馆发生倒塌事故，当时有七人在场。

Officials said rescue operations have ended.翻译:官员称救援行动已经结束。

Initial reports said three people, possibly children, were at the venue or trapped inside when it collapsed. State media said the incident occurred at 7:20 p.m. (1120 GMT).翻译:初步报告称，倒塌时，现场有三人（可能是儿童）在现场或被困在里面。官方媒体称，事件发生在晚上 7 点 20 分（格林威治标准时间 1120）。

According to a local resident, the collapsed gymnasium is a basketball arena where youth basketball training is held, Global Times reported late Monday.翻译:据《环球时报》周一晚间报道，当地居民称，倒塌的体育馆是一个篮球场，用于进行青少年篮球训练。

Video images on social media showed a concrete structure caved in and covered by snowfall. Another video from The Paper, a Shanghai government-run media outlet, showed a woman running toward the collapsed area while crying and shouting "my son is still inside".翻译:社交媒体上的视频图像显示，一座混凝土结构塌陷并被降雪覆盖。上海官方媒体澎湃新闻的另一段视频显示，一名妇女一边哭一边跑向倒塌区域，大喊“我儿子还在里面”。

The venue where the accident occurred belongs to the New Sunshine Fitness Club in Huanan County, according to the county government. The club could not be immediately reached for comment.翻译:据县政府介绍，事故发生地点属于桦南县新阳光健身俱乐部。记者未能立即联系到该俱乐部置评。

The cause of the accident is under investigation, officials said, and the person in charge of the gym, also managed by New Sunshine, has been detained by the police.翻译:官方称，事故原因正在调查中，同为新阳光管理的健身房负责人已被警方拘留。

It was not immediately known what caused the collapse, but the country's northernmost province was slammed by harsh cold and blizzard weather throughout Monday that wreaked havoc on public transportation and closed schools.翻译:目前尚不清楚导致倒塌的原因，但该国最北端的省份整个周一都遭受严寒和暴风雪天气的袭击，对公共交通造成严重破坏，学校关闭。

More blizzard conditions are expected on Tuesday in Heilongjiang, including Jiamusi, CCTV news said, with warnings of icy roads, downed power lines and other snow-related obstructions.翻译:据央视新闻报道，周二，包括佳木斯在内的黑龙江省预计将出现更多暴风雪，并发出道路结冰、电线倒塌和其他与雪有关的障碍物的警告。

In July, 11 people were killed after the concrete roof of a school gymnasium in China's Qiqihar city collapsed.翻译:7月，中国齐齐哈尔市一所学校体育馆的混凝土屋顶倒塌，造成11人死亡。

Authorities had said that collapse was due to construction materials weighing on the roof. Heavy rains had drenched the region for several days.翻译:当局表示，倒塌是由于建筑材料压在屋顶上造成的。连日来，该地区一直下大雨。

"I remember that safety inspections were conducted on various gymnasiums after the Qiqihar No. 34 Middle School gymnasium collapsed in July," said a netizen on China's Weibo social media platform. "What was found? Another gymnasium collapse occurred in three months."翻译:“我记得7月份齐齐哈尔三十四中体育馆倒塌后，对各个体育馆进行了安全检查，”中国微博社交媒体平台上的一位网友说。 “发现了什么？三个月后又发生了一起体育馆倒塌事故。”

Reporting by Bernard Orr and Shanghai newsroom; Additional reporting by Ella Cao; Editing by Gerry Doyle翻译:伯纳德·奥尔和上海新闻编辑室的报道； Ella Cao 的补充报道；格里·多伊尔编辑
item.author: Bernard Orr

item.title: 参议员以中国为由敦促美国采取措施提高电池产量
item.description:
Two influential Democratic U.S. senators urged the Energy Department to take steps to boost U.S. battery manufacturing and next-generation battery research, citing China's dominance and export controls, according to a letter seen by Reuters.翻译:路透社看到的一封信显示，两位有影响力的美国民主党参议员敦促能源部采取措施促进美国电池制造和下一代电池研究，理由是中国的主导地位和出口管制。

Senate Intelligence Committee Chair Mark Warner and Energy Committee Chair Joe Manchin cited experts saying that the United States is "ten to twenty years behind Asia in commercialization of battery technology," and noted that China accounts for more than 75% of battery cell production.翻译:参议院情报委员会主席马克·沃纳和能源委员会主席乔·曼钦援引专家的话称，美国“在电池技术商业化方面落后亚洲十到二十年”，并指出中国占电池产量的75%以上。

"The U.S. must become a leader in manufacturing batteries and battery components, while securing our supply chains for the materials that make up those components," the senators wrote in a previously unreported letter seen by Reuters, citing China's decision last month to restrict exports of graphite, critical to manufacturing battery anodes.翻译:参议员们在路透社看到的一封此前未报道的信中写道：“美国必须成为电池和电池组件制造领域的领导者，同时确保我们构成这些组件的材料的供应链安全。”信中援引了中国上个月限制电池出口的决定。石墨，对于制造电池阳极至关重要。

China dominates the global EV battery supply chain including production of graphite - the single largest component.翻译:中国在全球电动汽车电池供应链中占据主导地位，其中包括最大的单一零部件石墨的生产。

The letter noted in 2022 the United States produced less than 10% of lithium-ion batteries in 2022 and said demand is expected to grow over seven times by 2035.翻译:信中指出，2022年美国锂离子电池产量不足10%，并表示到2035年需求预计将增长七倍以上。

The letter wants a committee briefing by Dec. 1 "on ongoing research and development of next-generation battery technologies."翻译:这封信希望委员会在 12 月 1 日之前就“正在进行的下一代电池技术的研究和开发”进行简报。

Lithium-ion batteries, the Pentagon has said, are crucial to thousands of military systems from "handheld radios, to unmanned submersibles and to future capabilities like lasers, directed energy weapons and hybrid electric tactical vehicles," the letter noted.翻译:信中指出，五角大楼表示，锂离子电池对数千个军事系统至关重要，从“手持无线电到无人潜水器，再到激光、定向能武器和混合电动战术车辆等未来功能”。

China accounts for 70% of the global production of lithium-ion batteries, the letter said, noting of five critical minerals required for most lithium-ion batteries, China "controls between 60-100% of the mining or refining for these minerals."翻译:信中称，中国占全球锂离子电池产量的70%，并指出，在大多数锂离子电池所需的五种关键矿物中，中国“控制着这些矿物60-100%的开采或精炼”。

The letter also said "it is critical that the U.S. lead in next-generation battery technology and alternative chemistries" and coordinate with the Department of Defense and other national security agencies "to support procurement of innovative, U.S.-developed energy storage technologies."翻译:信中还表示，“美国在下一代电池技术和替代化学物质方面处于领先地位”，并与国防部和其他国家安全机构协调“以支持采购美国开发的创新能源存储技术”。

A spokesperson for Energy Secretary Jennifer Granholm did not immediately respond to a request for comment.翻译:能源部长詹妮弗·格兰霍姆的发言人没有立即回应置评请求。

Reporting by David Shepardson; Editing by Leslie Adler and Stephen Coates翻译:大卫·谢泼德森报道；莱斯利·阿德勒和斯蒂芬·科茨编辑
item.author: David Shepardson

item.title: 2000-2021年中国借出1.34万亿美元，重点从“一带一路”转向救助金融报告
item.description:
Chinese financial institutions lent $1.34 trillion to developing countries from 2000 to 2021, U.S. researchers at AidData said in a report that showed the world's biggest bilateral lender switching from infrastructure to rescue lending.翻译:AidData的美国研究人员在一份报告中表示，从2000年到2021年，中国金融机构向发展中国家提供了1.34万亿美元的贷款，该报告显示全球最大的双边贷款机构从基础设施贷款转向救援贷款。

While lending commitments peaked at almost $136 billion in 2016, China still committed to almost $80 billion of loans and grants in 2021 according to the data, which captures almost 21,000 projects in 165 low and middle income countries as probably the most comprehensive dataset of its type.翻译:数据显示，虽然贷款承诺在 2016 年达到近 1,360 亿美元的峰值，但中国仍承诺在 2021 年提供近 800 亿美元的贷款和赠款，该数据涵盖了 165 个低收入和中等收入国家的近 21,000 个项目，这可能是同类数据中最全面的数据集。

Overseas finance has won Beijing allies across the developing world, while drawing criticism from the West and in some recipient countries, including Sri Lanka and Zambia, that infrastructure projects it funded saddled them with debt they were unable to repay.翻译:海外融资在发展中国家赢得了北京的盟友，但也引起了西方和斯里兰卡和赞比亚等一些受援国的批评，称其资助的基础设施项目让这些国家背负了无法偿还的债务。

Both the sources and the focus of China's overseas financing, have changed, the data showed.翻译:数据显示，中国海外融资的来源和重点都发生了变化。

In 2013, when President Xi Jinping launched the Belt and Road Initiative to build infrastructure across the developing world, China's policy banks accounted for over half of the lending. Their share started falling from 2015 and was 22% by 2021.翻译:2013年，当习近平主席发起“ 一带一路”倡议以在发展中国家建设基础设施时，中国的政策性银行占了贷款的一半以上。他们的份额从 2015 年开始下降，到 2021 年降至 22%。

The People's Bank of China and the State Administration of Foreign Exchange (SAFE), which manages China's foreign currency reserves, accounted for more than half of lending in 2021, almost all bailout lending.翻译:管理中国外汇储备的中国人民银行和国家外汇管理局（SAFE）占2021年贷款的一半以上，几乎全部是救助贷款。

"Beijing is navigating an unfamiliar and uncomfortable role— as the world's largest official debt collector," said the report by AidData, a research lab at William and Mary university.翻译:威廉玛丽大学研究实验室 AidData 的报告称，“北京正在扮演一个陌生且令人不安的角色——作为世界上最大的官方收债人。”

Much of China's growing rescue lending is denominated in renminbi, the report found, with loans in the Chinese currency overtaking U.S. dollars in 2020. Overdue payments to Chinese lenders have also risen.翻译:报告发现，中国不断增长的救援贷款大部分以人民币计价，到2020年，人民币贷款将超过美元。​​中国银行的逾期付款也有所增加。

One way China is managing repayment risk is through foreign currency cash escrow accounts it controls, AidData said. The arrangement is controversial because it gives China debt seniority, meaning other lenders, including multilateral development banks, could get paid second during any coordinated debt relief.翻译:AidData 表示，中国管理还款风险的一种方式是通过其控制的外币现金托管账户。这一安排颇具争议，因为它赋予中国债务优先权，这意味着包括多边开发银行在内的其他贷款机构可能在任何协调债务减免期间获得第二位偿付。

AidData identified 15 countries, primarily in Africa, with escrow accounts totalling a combined $2.5 billion at their peak in June 2023.翻译:AidData 确定了 15 个国家（主要是非洲国家）的托管账户总额在 2023 年 6 月达到峰值时达到 25 亿美元。

Brad Parks, the study's lead author, said they were not able to identify all such accounts, as they are normally kept private. He noted, though, that they had found collateralised loans worth $614 billion and that cash was the main source of collateral required by Chinese lenders, indicating that the amount in escrow accounts could be far higher than $2.5 billion.翻译:该研究的主要作者布拉德·帕克斯 (Brad Parks) 表示，他们无法识别所有此类帐户，因为这些帐户通常都是保密的。不过，他指出，他们发现了价值 6140 亿美元的抵押贷款，而现金是中国贷方所需抵押品的主要来源，这表明托管账户中的金额可能远远高于 25 亿美元。

China is also working more with multilateral lenders and Western commercial banks. Half of its non-emergency lending in 2021 was syndicated loans, 80% of that alongside Western banks and international financial institutions.翻译:中国还与多边贷款机构和西方商业银行开展更多合作。 2021 年，其非紧急贷款中有一半是银团贷款，其中 80% 是与西方银行和国际金融机构合作的。

The destinations of Chinese overseas lending have also changed. Loan commitments to African countries fell from 31% of the total in 2018 to 12% in 2021, while lending to European countries almost quadrupled to 23%.翻译:中国海外贷款的目的地也发生了变化。对非洲国家的贷款承诺从 2018 年占贷款总额的 31% 下降到 2021 年的 12%，而对欧洲国家的贷款几乎翻了两番，达到 23%。

A different dataset showed loan commitments to African countries falling to a 20-year low in 2022.翻译:另一个数据集显示，2022 年对非洲国家的贷款承诺降至20 年来的最低点。

Reporting by Rachel Savage and Clare Baldwin Editing by Tomasz Janowski翻译:雷切尔·萨维奇和克莱尔·鲍德温报道 托马斯·雅诺夫斯基编辑
item.author: Rachel Savage, Clare Baldwin
